characters.exemplarCharacters: [𖫧 𖫨 𖫩 𖫪 𖫫 𖫬 𖫭]

references.reference: Michael Everson and Charles Riley: Revised proposal for encoding the Bassa Vah script in the SMP of the UCS. ISO/IEC JTC1/SC2/WG2 N3847 L2/10–217. July 31, 2010. Page 1: “Vowels in Bassa Vah are written as letters with obligatory diacritical marks which indicate the tone of the vowel. [...] the tone is obligatory (a Bassa word is misspelled without it)“

Michael Everson and Charles Riley: Revised proposal for encoding the Bassa Vah script in the SMP of the UCS. ISO/IEC JTC1/SC2/WG2 N3847 L2/10–217. July 31, 2010. Page 1: “[T]he un-marked vowels are never used alone, except in discussions of the alphabet itself.“

Michael Everson and Charles Riley: Revised proposal for encoding the Bassa Vah script in the SMP of the UCS. ISO/IEC JTC1/SC2/WG2 N3847 L2/10–217. July 31, 2010. Page 2: “The Latin FULL STOP may be used, but a Bassa Vah COMMA and FULL STOP are both found in fonts.“
